properties.name: Org
properties.help: Azure DevOps organization URL. You can configure the default organization using az devops configure -d organization=ORG_URL. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config. Example: https://dev.azure.com/MyOrganizationName/.

properties.name: Project
properties.help: Name or ID of the project. You can configure the default project using az devops configure -d project=NAME_OR_ID. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Id
properties.help: ID of the pull request.

properties.name: RemoteName
properties.help: Name of git remote against which PR is raised.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: AutoComplete
properties.help: Set the pull request to complete automatically when all policies have passed and the source branch can be merged into the target branch.

properties.name: BypassPolicy
properties.help: Bypass required policies (if any) and completes the pull request once it can be merged.

properties.name: BypassPolicyReason
properties.help: Reason for bypassing the required policies.

properties.name: DeleteSourceBranch
properties.help: Delete the source branch after the pull request has been completed and merged into the target branch.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: Description for the new pull request. Can include markdown. Each value sent to this arg will be a new line. For example: --description "First Line" "Second Line".

properties.name: Detect
properties.help: Automatically detect organization.

properties.name: Draft
properties.help: Use this flag to create the pull request in draft/work in progress mode.

properties.name: MergeCommitMessage
properties.help: Message displayed when commits are merged.

properties.name: Open
properties.help: Open the pull request in your web browser.

properties.name: Org
properties.help: Azure DevOps organization URL. You can configure the default organization using az devops configure -d organization=ORG_URL. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config. Example: https://dev.azure.com/MyOrganizationName/.

properties.name: Project
properties.help: Name or ID of the project. You can configure the default project using az devops configure -d project=NAME_OR_ID. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config.

properties.name: Repository
properties.help: Name or ID of the repository to create the pull request in.

properties.name: Reviewers
properties.help: Additional users or groups to include as reviewers on the new pull request. Space separated.

properties.name: SourceBranch
properties.help: Name of the source branch. Example: "dev".

properties.name: Squash
properties.help: Squash the commits in the source branch when merging into the target branch.

properties.name: TargetBranch
properties.help: Name of the target branch. If not specified, defaults to the default branch of the target repository.

properties.name: Title
properties.help: Title for the new pull request.

properties.name: TransitionWorkItems
properties.help: Transition any work items linked to the pull request into the next logical state. (e.g. Active -> Resolved).

properties.name: WorkItems
properties.help: IDs of the work items to link to the new pull request. Space separated.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Creator
properties.help: Limit results to pull requests created by this user.

properties.name: Detect
properties.help: Automatically detect organization.

properties.name: IncludeLinks
properties.help: Include _links for each pull request.

properties.name: Org
properties.help: Azure DevOps organization URL. You can configure the default organization using az devops configure -d organization=ORG_URL. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config. Example: https://dev.azure.com/MyOrganizationName/.

properties.name: Project
properties.help: Name or ID of the project. You can configure the default project using az devops configure -d project=NAME_OR_ID. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config.

properties.name: Repository
properties.help: Name or ID of the repository.

properties.name: Reviewer
properties.help: Limit results to pull requests where this user is a reviewer.

properties.name: Skip
properties.help: Number of pull requests to skip.

properties.name: SourceBranch
properties.help: Limit results to pull requests that originate from this source branch.

properties.name: Status
properties.help: Limit results to pull requests with this status.

properties.name: TargetBranch
properties.help: Limit results to pull requests that target this branch.

properties.name: Top
properties.help: Maximum number of pull requests to list.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Id
properties.help: ID of the pull request.

properties.name: Vote
properties.help: New vote value for the pull request.

properties.name: Detect
properties.help: Automatically detect organization.

properties.help: Azure DevOps organization URL. You can configure the default organization using az devops configure -d organization=ORG_URL. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config. Example: https://dev.azure.com/MyOrganizationName/.

properties.name: BypassPolicyReason

properties.name: DeleteSourceBranch

properties.help: New description for the pull request.  Can include markdown.  Each value sent to this arg will be a new line. For example: --description "First Line" "Second Line".

properties.help: Message displayed when commits are merged.

properties.name: TransitionWorkItems
properties.help: Transition any work items linked to the pull request into the next logical state. (e.g. Active -> Resolved).

properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Blocking
properties.help: Whether the policy should be blocking or not.

properties.name: Branch
properties.help: Branch on which this policy should be applied. For example: master.

properties.name: Enabled
properties.help: Whether the policy is enabled or not.

properties.name: RepositoryId
properties.help: Id of the repository on which to apply the policy.

properties.name: BranchMatchType
properties.help: Determines how the branch argument is used to apply a policy. If value is 'exact', the policy will be applied on a branch which has an exact match on the --branch argument. If value is 'prefix' the policy is applied across all branch folders that match the prefix provided by the --branch argument.

properties.help: Name or ID of the project. You can configure the default project using az devops configure -d project=NAME_OR_ID. Required if not configured as default or picked up via git config.

properties.name: RepositoryId
properties.help: Id of the repository on which to apply the policy.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: AllowDownvotes
properties.help: Whether to allow downvotes or not.

properties.name: Blocking
properties.help: Whether the policy should be blocking or not.

properties.name: Branch
properties.help: Branch on which this policy should be applied. For example: master.

properties.name: CreatorVoteCounts
properties.help: Whether the creator's vote counts or not.

properties.name: Enabled
properties.help: Whether the policy is enabled or not.

properties.name: MinimumApproverCount
properties.help: Minimum number of approvers required. For example: 2.

properties.name: RepositoryId
properties.help: Id of the repository on which to apply the policy.

properties.name: ResetOnSourcePush
properties.help: Whether to reset source on push.

properties.name: BranchMatchType
properties.help: Determines how the branch argument is used to apply a policy. If value is 'exact', the policy will be applied on a branch which has an exact match on the --branch argument. If value is 'prefix' the policy is applied across all branch folders that match the prefix provided by the --branch argument.
